intro: Calycobolus zairensis, commonly known as the Zaire calycobolus, is a rare and unusual plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which features a prominent calyx that persists throughout the flowering period. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elongated and have a waxy surface, which helps reduce water loss in its humid environment. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Calycobolus zairensis is considered a botanically significant but poorly understood species.
